greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes of the form 26k+1 generated recursively. Initial prime is 53. General term is a(n) = Min {p is prime; p divides (R^13 - 1)/(R - 1); p == 1 (mod 13)}, where Q is the product of previous terms in the sequence and R = 13*Q.
comment: All prime divisors of (R^13 - 1)/(R - 1) different from 13 are congruent to 1 modulo 26.
reference: M. Ram Murty, Problems in Analytic Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, NY, (2001), pp. 208-209.
link: N. Hobson, Home page (listed in lieu of email address)
results.author: Nick Hobson, Nov 18 2006
ext: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 24 2011
